availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Martin B. Mosley (Estill County, KY, constable and merchant)

body.p: Estill County, Kentucky, constable and merchant. Virginia native. Married to Emily Mosley. Father of Olivia P. Mosley, John W. Mosley, Charles H. Mosley, Alice Mosley, William Mosley, Fannie Mosley, and Annie Mosley. Constable in Estill County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Estill County in 1850. Merchant in Estill County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill lCounty, p. 59B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 493.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, Irvine, p. 275.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, Irvine, p. 558B.
